Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, interior covered with a brown resinous deposit, exterior covered with red/brown coloured slip and faint traces of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.365-6)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36355) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36355)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 365 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
